text:
PARTYGOERS in Berlin will see a “safe zone” for women set up at New Year’s Eve celebrations for the first time ever.
The new security measures will be in place at the Brandenburg Gate and are a result of heightened concerns in Germany about sexual assaults at public events.
EPA Preparations for New Year's Eve celebrations are underway at the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin
The safe space, situated on Ebertstrasse, will be staffed by members of the German Red Cross and will provide support to women who have been assaulted or feel harassed.
Police in Berlin have also advised women to seek help if they feel threatened and to only carry a small bag with no valuable items.
The special measures come after staggering numbers of assaults and robberies were carried out at Cologne’s New Year’s Eve celebrations two years ago.
Germans were left horrified after almost 1,200 women came forward claiming to have been attacked by groups of men ‘from migrant backgrounds’.
AFP Police made a number of arrests in Cologne in the early hours of New Year's Day 2016 following reports of assaults
EPA Anti-islam protests held in January 2016 following mass sexual assaults in Cologne on New Year's Eve
The reports fuelled anti-migrant sentiment across Germany, with the country welcoming in excess of 1.1 million refugees in 2015 alone.
Hundreds of thousands of revellers are expected to descend on Berlin’s festivities on Sunday.
Security is expected to be extremely high with strict search and entry processes in place.
AFP Angela Merkel speaking at the inauguration of the memorial for victims of the 2016 Berlin Christmas Market attack
Backpacks, large bags and alcohol will be banned at the Brandenburg Gate festivities.
The idea of a safe space for women has not been welcomed by everyone, with some critics claiming it is discriminatory.
Others claim the measures in place will not tackle the problem at the root cause.

Sexual offences carried out by migrants in Germany have doubled in the last year, according to statistics released in June.
A report from German authorities revealed more than 3,300 sex attacks involved migrants in the space of 12 months.
The crimes range from sexual assault to rape, and were reported in Berlin, Hamburg, Stuttgart and Dortmund.

title: Berlin’s New Year's party will have ‘safe zones’ for women for the first time ever amid claims of hundreds of ‘migrant’ sex attacks at previous NYE events in Germany
